intro: Gomphostigma scoparioides, commonly known as the narrow-leafed stonewort, is a freshwater algae belonging to the order Zygnematales. It is characterized by its filamentous structure and the presence of distinct, spiral-shaped chloroplasts. The plant typically forms dense mats on the surface of still or slow-moving waters. Its morphology includes short, branching filaments with paired, oval cells that are often arranged in a spiral pattern. Gomphostigma scoparioides plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by contributing to primary production and serving as a food source for various aquatic organisms.
